result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Patrick McDonald is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Nicholas Patrick McDonald was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 3 dismissed. Defendant is eligible for expungement.
Concurrent with: count 2 of 15CF117

miscConds.notes:
$500.00 applied toward restitution. Balance of restitution for count 1 of 15CF117 payable through probation.

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

-  Psychological/Psychiatric evaluation within 30 days.  If requested cooperate with any evaluation, assessment and/or program as directed.
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-  Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-  Not to possess a firearm
-  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
-  No contact with L. Jerald, B. Myers, M. Brandt, B. Young, W. Long
-  Apology letter
-  Restorative Justice if requested.
-  Follow all rules and regulations of DOC/Agent.
-  Pay supervision fees.

10 days credit against ultimate sentence.

Court costs for count 1 on 15CF117 payable through probation.  

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

timeConds.notes: 50 days stayed. The balance of 10 days may be served over two consecutive weekends. Commence jail no later than 10-2-15. Report Friday by 6:30 pm and released on the following Monday at 8:30 am.

Court costs for count 2 on 15CF117 payable through probation.   

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Clerk gave DE a courtesy call to let him know that he missed his Aug 1st pymt & is scheduled for FTP action today. DE stated he completely forgot & that he'll make pymt tonight. DE is approved to make pymt before 8 am tomrw or FTP will take place first thing tomrw morning. DE was encouraged to pay for Aug & Sept since his Sept pymt is due next wk. Includes 14CF207, 15CF117, 16TR1459, 16TR2240, 16TR2241, 16TR2242, 18TR2506.  jaf
filed by DE requesting to have DL reinstated.      Per RMW on 10/21/19- Vacate Suspension.  Clerk called DE. bph

DE called to inquire about the paperwork he rec'd in the mail re: FTP. DE was advised that he made his Sept pymt late, but is now current & his Pymt Plan has been reinstated just this once. DE was advised that if he were to miss another pymt, he will either be warranted or sent to Collections. DE inquired about getting his license reinstated & was advised he may submit a request in writing. DE stated he will drop his request off tomrw. Includes 14CF207, 15CF117, 15CM739, 16TR1458, 16TR1459, 16TR2240, 16TR2241, 16TR2242, 18TR2506.  jaf

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $500.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.


- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  L. Jerald, B. Myers, M. Brandt, B. Young, W. Long and Viking Coca Cola Distribution except for purposes of restitution.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
